Projects

Projects (5)
Psychidae of Korea
Project
Systematic and evolutionary study of the Psychidae in Korea
View
Systematic study of the family Gracillariidae (Lepidoptera) in Korea
Project
This study will be conducted to review the family Gracillariidae with the morphological characteristics including genitalic structures, distributional ranges and host plants information in Korea. Also, DNA barcode data, based on the material with correct identification, will be constructed for establishing the molecular identification sources. Additionally, RNA and protein gene will be analyzed for investigation of the evolutionary tendency with available materials. The main aims of the study are taxonomic review of the family and systematic analysis with biological information for various applied areas including plant protection, plant quarantine and education of insect taxonomy.
View

Project
This study will be conducted to review the family Gracillariidae with the morphological characteristics including genitalic structures, distributional ranges and host plants information in Korea. Also, DNA barcode data, based on the material with correct identification, will be constructed for establishing the molecular identification sources. The main aims of the study are taxonomic review of the family and systematic analysis with biological information for various applied areas including plant protection, plant quarantine and education of insect taxonomy.
